channel.description: good robots do what they're told

item.title: What Makes a Good Pair?
item.description: What makes a great pair programming partner? Effective pairing requires communication, engagement, listening, and genuine collaboration — not just sitting next to someone.

item.title: More on Micro DSLs
item.description: Another micro-DSL example: a fluent find-in-list API. Shows how to build a natural, readable DSL for searching heterogeneous collections in Java.

item.title: Interfaces vs Class impostorisers
item.description: When is using a class imposturiser in JMock acceptable? Explores the trade-offs of mocking classes vs interfaces, particularly when working with third-party or legacy code like SWT.

item.title: SWT Applications on Mac OS X
item.description: Fix invalid thread access errors in SWT applications on Mac OS X using the -XstartOnFirstThread JVM option.

item.title: SWT Support for Window Licker
item.description: SWT support for Window Licker, the rich UI testing framework. Covers implementing basic SWT support as a patch to the Window Licker project.

item.title: JUnit and Threaded Tests
item.description: JUnit tests with threads can produce false positives because the test runner calls System.exit() before threads complete. Learn how to wait for threads in tests.

item.title: Inheritance vs Composition
item.description: Java's Stack class extends Vector, making it not a true stack. A real-world example of why composition beats inheritance for code reuse.

item.title: Be more Expressive with Builders
item.description: Create more expressive Java code using the builder pattern and method chaining to build micro-DSLs. Demonstrated with CountDownLatch as a practical example.

item.title: Deprecated Annotation
item.description: Why didn't Sun add a value property to the @Deprecated annotation so you can describe what to use instead? A look at the annotation and its limitations.

item.title: Be Explicit with the UI Thread
item.description: Understand the SWT UI thread and how to avoid invalid thread access errors by being explicit about which thread is the main UI thread when testing.

item.title: Inferring the Types in a Micro DSL
item.description: Java struggles with type inference when multiple generics are in play. Examines how to work around these limitations when building a generic fluent find-in-list DSL.

item.title: Less is More
item.description: Allocating less heap size to the JVM actually means you can create more native threads.

item.title: SWTBot vs Window Licker
item.description: An experience report comparing SWTBot and Window Licker for GUI testing. Covers architectural differences, event simulation approaches, and API usability.

item.title: Convert a Callable to a Runnable
item.description: The Executors framework can convert Runnable to Callable but not the reverse. Here's how to wrap a Callable as a Runnable to schedule it at a fixed rate.

item.title: is(not(instanceOf(smell)));
item.description: Is instanceof really a code smell? Examines when using instanceof is reasonable and why its bad reputation is sometimes undeserved.

item.title: Abstracting ReentrantReadWriteLock
item.description: Java's ReentrantReadWriteLock allows concurrent reads but serialised writes. Learn how to abstract the lock boilerplate safely using try/finally blocks.

item.title: Performance Monitoring Basics
item.description: Set up performance monitoring early. Covers real-time performance metrics, resource usage tracking, instrumentation with AOP/AspectJ, and tools like JMX and Java Melody.

item.title: Java source for Mac OSX
item.description: Getting Java source code on Mac OS X — Apple's Java distribution quirks and how to access JDK source for IDE integration.

item.title: Thawte claim I'm not to be trusted...
item.description: Thawte is discontinuing free personal email certificates and web of trust. Impact on signing JARs for Java WebStart deployments.

item.title: Time Flies 1.0
item.description: Announcing tempus-fugit 1.0, a Java library for testing concurrent and time-sensitive code. Now available on Maven Central.

item.title: Deadlock detection in Java
item.description: Detect Java deadlocks programmatically using the DeadlockDetector from tempus-fugit. Includes a JUnit rule to fail tests that deadlock.

item.title: Atomiticy of the Thread class
item.description: Java's Thread class does not maintain thread state atomically with its interrupt status flag, leading to subtle race conditions in state checking.

item.title: Flickering Tests and a JUnit Rule
item.description: Automatically repeat intermittently failing tests using tempus-fugit's @Intermittent JUnit rule. Identify non-deterministic tests and make them deterministic.

item.title: Type Safe Annotation
item.description: Java insists enum annotation values must be enum constants, preventing type-safe runtime checks. Explores why this is and what it means for concurrency annotations.

item.title: Nibbles the Cat & Concurrency
item.description: A concrete deadlock example in Java showing how two threads can deadlock acquiring the same locks in opposite orders. Demonstrates DeadlockDetector in action.

item.title: Running JUnit tests in parallel
item.description: Run JUnit tests concurrently using tempus-fugit's @RunWith(ConcurrentTestRunner.class). Speed up test suites by running tests in parallel.

item.title: Wrapping Exceptions is Dull
item.description: Wrapping checked exceptions to rethrow as RuntimeExceptions is verbose boilerplate. Use tempus-fugit's Exceptions helper to wrap them automatically.

item.title: Setter vs Constructor Injection
item.description: Compare setter injection vs constructor injection in Java. Constructor injection promotes immutability and clearer dependencies — here's why to prefer it.

item.title: Un/Marshalling
item.description: Almost all unmarshalling frameworks impose constraints on your application. Sometimes rolling your own simple unmarshalling logic is simpler and more flexible.

item.title: Objectives
item.description: Put the YOU into your objectives. Use SMART+Y goal setting to make career goals personal, meaningful, and motivating — not just things your manager wants.

item.title: Generate Concordion Overviews
item.description: Generate a Concordion test overview page automatically using the Concordion Ant Task. Useful for creating navigable acceptance test suites.

item.title: Changing Test Gears
item.description: Choosing the right level of testing — unit, integration, or acceptance — is a subtle skill. Learn when each is appropriate and how to avoid duplication across test levels.

item.title: Growing Team Skills
item.description: Use a competency depth distribution chart to visualise your team's skills and identify gaps. A practical tool for agile coaches to guide training and development.

item.title: Lambdas vs. Closures
item.description: What's the difference between a lambda and a closure? Clear definitions and Java examples to understand these foundational functional programming concepts.

item.title: Pairing Honestly
item.description: Practical tips for more honest and effective pair programming in agile teams. Covers the pair stairs technique and how to get the most from pairing.

item.title: Logging is evil but...
item.description: Logging clutters code and couples concerns. Learn how to treat logging as a feature, separate it from business logic, and write tests that assert on log output.

item.title: tempus-fugit 1.1 released
item.description: tempus-fugit 1.1 released. The Java library for testing concurrent and time-sensitive code gains new features and improvements.

item.title: JDK7 Article in JavaTech Journal
item.description: My article 'Java the language vs Java the platform' published in the Java Tech Journal. A tour of what's new and noteworthy in Java 7.

item.title: JDK7 Previewed
item.description: A preview of noteworthy Java 7 features: diamond operator, try-with-resources, switch on strings, and the foundation they lay for Java 8 lambdas.

item.title: Logging is still evil but...
item.description: Make assertions against Log4J in tests using a custom appender. If you can't avoid logging, treat it as a requirement and write tests that verify log output.

item.title: Catching Multiple Exceptions (and rethrowing them all!)
item.description: How to catch multiple exceptions, process them independently, then rethrow them all. A pattern for collecting and re-throwing exceptions in batch processing.

item.title: Reflecting on Interviewing Mistakes
item.description: Reflecting on the last few years of heavily interviewing for agile developers. We've got the process down but often fool ourselves and let good guys slip through. Right or wrong answers don't really have a place because there's never a right or wrong answer in what we do.

item.title: Java source on Mac
item.description: How to get Java source code on your Mac for IDE source attachment. Covers Maven and environment configuration.

item.title: Transaction Management without the Frameworks
item.description: Avoid declarative transaction management frameworks like Spring. Roll your own imperative transaction management for more control and testability.

item.title: Force IE8 to Display JSON with Jersey
item.description: Fix IE8 prompting to download JSON responses from Jersey REST services by setting the correct Content-Type and response headers.

item.title: Hexagonal Acceptance Testing
item.description: Apply hexagonal (ports and adapters) architecture to structure acceptance tests. Test at the application boundary without spinning up the full stack.

item.title: Expecting Exceptions JUnit Rule
item.description: Replace the try-fail-catch anti-pattern with JUnit's ExpectedException rule for cleaner, more readable exception testing.

item.title: Exception Handling as a System Wide Concern
item.description: Treat exception handling as a system-wide concern. Identify boundaries in your application and handle exceptions consistently at those boundaries.

item.title: Building Better Exceptions
item.description: Design better exceptions by treating them as proper objects with behaviour. Apply the Law of Demeter and 'tell don't ask' to keep exception handling clean.

item.title: Tools for bad.robots
item.description: Introducing robotooling: a collection of open-source Java utilities capturing reusable patterns around HTTP, Excel, Concordion, and concurrent testing.

item.title: Scala Exception Handling
item.description: Exception handling in Scala: from familiar try/catch with pattern matching to functional approaches using Either and Option types.

item.title: Scala as a Functional OO Hybrid
item.description: Scala as a functional/OO hybrid: what does 'functional' really mean? Explores pure functions, side effects, and referential transparency in Scala.

item.title: Stop Ignoring @Rules
item.description: Stop overlooking JUnit's @Rule annotation. Discover how ExternalResource, TemporaryFolder and custom rules make test setup and teardown cleaner.

item.title: HTTP Encoding Schemes
item.description: Understand the difference between URL encoding and form encoding (x-www-form-urlencoded) and how to correctly encode HTTP request parameters in Java.

item.title: Pair Tests: What Candidates Can Expect
item.description: What candidates can expect from a pair programming interview test. Tips on how to prepare, what interviewers are looking for, and how to handle the pairing exercise.

item.title: HTTP Should be Simple
item.description: A simple introduction to HTTP and REST. Covers HTTP verbs, status codes, and practical Java examples using the simple-http library.

item.title: Getting Things Done, Part II
item.description: Part two of Getting Things Done: dig into the GTD workflow — collecting, processing, organising, reviewing, and doing. Practical tips for making GTD work day to day.

item.title: Mountain Lion Carnage
item.description: The aftermath of upgrading to Mac OS X Mountain Lion. What broke, what needed fixing, and tips for developers upgrading their Mac.

item.title: Getting Things Done, Part I
item.description: An introduction to Getting Things Done (GTD) — David Allen's system for stress-free productivity. How it compares with agile practices and how to get started.

item.title: FreeAgent, OAuth & HTTP (Part I)
item.description: OAuth and HTTP part I: understanding the OAuth authorisation flow. Covers the three-legged OAuth dance, tokens, and how to implement it in Java with Scribe.

item.title: FreeAgent, OAuth & HTTP (Part II)
item.description: OAuth and HTTP part II: calling the FreeAgent API with OAuth. Step-by-step guide to obtaining and using OAuth tokens with the Scribe library in Java.

item.title: FreeAgent, OAuth & HTTP (Part III)
item.description: OAuth and HTTP part III: making signed OAuth requests to the FreeAgent API using Java and Scribe. Practical end-to-end OAuth integration example.

item.title: Play it Next App
item.description: How to use the 'Play Next' feature in iTunes and the iOS music app to queue songs without disrupting your current playlist.

item.title: Daily Standups Don't Work
item.description: Daily standups often fail because they become status reports. Learn why standups don't work and what to do instead to improve team communication and flow.

item.title: Sending Messages vs Method Invocation
item.description: Alan Kay's original vision of OOP was about message passing, not method calls. Explores the conceptual difference and why it matters for good object-oriented design.

item.title: Diff Excel with Java and Hamcrest
item.description: Compare Excel spreadsheets in Java tests using Hamcrest matchers and Apache POI. The simple-excel library makes asserting on spreadsheet content straightforward.

item.title: Java Stack vs Deque

item.title: Useful Git Commands
item.description: A collection of useful Git commands including how to delete remote branches, switch between SSH and HTTPS, and other handy tips for everyday Git use.

item.title: Mac Tips
item.description: Handy Mac OS X tips for developers: keyboard shortcuts, Finder tricks, and workflow improvements to speed up your daily development tasks.

item.title: Writing my Book
item.description: Behind the scenes of writing 'Effective Acceptance Testing' — choosing Leanpub for self-publishing, the writing process, and why I decided to write the book.

item.title: Automatically rebase on git pull
item.description: Configure Git to automatically rebase instead of merge on every pull. Covers global and per-repository configuration, including IntelliJ IDEA settings.

item.title: Calculate the Optimum Number of Threads
item.description: Calculate the optimal number of threads for a Java application. Covers CPU-bound vs IO-bound workloads and the formula for sizing thread pools correctly.

item.title: Currying Functions in Java & Scala
item.description: Currying transforms a multi-argument function into a chain of single-argument functions. Practical examples in both Java and Scala.

item.title: Yet Another TeamCity Build Monitor
item.description: Radiate is a TeamCity build monitor that aggregates all build statuses into a single pass/fail — no cherry-picking which failures to ignore.

item.title: IntelliJ IDEA Retina Support JDK 1.7+
item.description: IntelliJ IDEA 13 retina support is broken on JDK 7 and JDK 8. Keep running on JDK 1.6 for crisp retina rendering on Macbooks.

item.title: Method References in Java 8
item.description: Java 8 method references explained clearly. Four types with real examples: static, bound instance, unbound instance, and constructor references.

item.title: Functional Interfaces in Java 8
item.description: Functional interfaces in Java 8 are single-method interfaces. Anywhere you use a lambda, you're using a functional interface. Learn the syntax and built-in examples.

item.title: Classes vs. Functions
item.description: Java 8 lambdas are not just syntactic sugar over anonymous classes. Explores the underlying bytecode differences and why lambdas and anonymous classes behave differently.

item.title: Udemy Java 8 Course
item.description: My 'What's new in Java 8' course is live on Udemy. Covers lambdas, streams, functional interfaces and more — get 10% off with coupon code BLOG10.

item.title: Dealing with Exceptions as Monads
item.description: Treat exceptions functionally using monadic types like Either, Option, and Try. Captures error handling in the type system and provides system-wide consistency.

item.title: Scala Mixins: The Right Way
item.description: Scala traits can be used for both polymorphism and mixins, but mixing these uses leads to trouble. Learn when using a trait as a mixin is genuinely appropriate.

item.title: Scala Learning Curve
item.description: What does the Scala learning curve look like? Expect quick initial progress followed by a slower ramp into advanced functional features like type classes and implicits.

item.title: JMock to Scalamock Cheat Sheet
item.description: Quick reference cheat sheet mapping JMock idioms to their Scalamock equivalents. Useful when migrating Java tests to Scala or learning Scalamock.

item.title: Implicit Parameters in Scala
item.description: Scala implicit parameters allow the compiler to automatically supply values marked implicit. Introduction to the three categories of Scala implicits.

item.title: Implicit Functions in Scala
item.description: Scala implicit functions convert types automatically when the compiler needs it. Learn how implicit conversion functions work and how to use them safely.

item.title: Easily Switch JDK on Mac
item.description: Easily switch between Java versions on Mac using the java_home utility. Includes bash function to set JAVA_HOME for any installed JDK version.

item.title: Pair Testing Doesn't Work
item.description: Pair tests are a poor proxy for real work. After years of giving and receiving them, the author argues for fairer, more realistic interview techniques.

item.description: Disable the LED on the Edimax EW-7811UN Wi-Fi dongle on Raspberry Pi by recompiling the kernel module. Includes a pre-built binary if you'd rather not compile.

item.title: Home Brew Temperature Logger
item.description: Build a home brew temperature logger for around $10 using a Raspberry Pi Zero and DS18B20 temperature sensor. Great starter IoT project with Scala server.

item.title: Standard Raspberry Pi Setup
item.description: A standard setup guide for Raspberry Pi including OS installation, SSH configuration, and basic system setup for headless operation.

item.title: Type Classes in Scala
item.description: Type classes in Scala provide ad-hoc polymorphism without inheritance. Learn the pattern using implicits and understand when type classes beat traditional OOP.

item.title: Upgrade Raspbian
item.description: Step-by-step guide to upgrading Raspbian from Jessie to Stretch on your Raspberry Pi.

item.title: Refactoring in 10 Minutes
item.description: An introduction to refactoring in 10 minutes. Java examples from Martin Fowler's book, plus a free xpdojo.org collection of XP training materials.

item.title: Upgrade Raspbian
item.description: Step-by-step guide to upgrading Raspbian from Stretch to Buster on your Raspberry Pi.

item.title: Easily Deploy Java to Debian
item.description: Package Java, Scala, or Kotlin apps as .deb files and deploy via apt. Level up your distribution strategy with proper Debian package management.

item.description: Step-by-step guide to building and publishing your own Debian/Ubuntu APT repository with aptly, including package publishing, signing with GPG, and client setup.

item.title: Evidencing Source Code Reviews
item.description: How to evidence source code reviews in regulated environments. Signed commits and pair programming as a code review mechanism without wasteful bureaucracy.

item.description: Exploring the history and implications of pull requests in software development. This post examines how PRs introduce delays, impact continuous integration, and discusses the relationship between trust and code review practices in agile teams.

item.title: Lead Time vs Cycle Time
item.description: Lead time and cycle time are often confused. Understand the subtle difference, their roots in lean manufacturing, and why DORA uses Lead Time for Changes as a key metric.

item.description: Compare an imperative and functional implementation of the Luhn Algorithm. See how functional programming emphasises transformations and immutability over state mutation.

item.title: Bank on Tech Panel Discussion
item.description: Deutsche Bank's Bank on Tech event in London, Birmingham, and Dublin brought together technical experts and thought leaders to reflect and learn.

item.title: DORA Metrics Meet Governance in Banking
item.description: Mike Long, Nathan Harvey and I discuss how DORA metrics can be aligned with governance frameworks in the banking industry. We posted the resulting article under the Team Topologies Expert View series.

item.title: A Spooky Story
item.description: One that terrifies us all... having to grep that impenetrable log file by hand. Is using a custom Log4j appender the way to avoid this nightmare? Is routing log events to a HTTP server a good idea or a hidden maintenance trap? Let's have a look at it.
